<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// maintain, and optimize execution of Passes.  The PassManager class ensures</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add a pass to the queue of passes to run.  This passes ownership of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the Pass to the PassManager.  When the PassManager is destroyed, the pass</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// will be destroyed as well, so there is no need to delete the pass.  This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// may even destroy the pass right away if it is found to be redundant. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// implies that all passes MUST be allocated with &#39;new&#39;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
